questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'learning rate' in gradient descent algorithms?

options.A: To determine the number of iterations
options.B: To control the step size in updating model weights

questions.question: Which of the following methods is used to evaluate the performance of a clustering algorithm?

options.A: Mean Absolute Error
options.B: Silhouette Score

questions.question: What is 'feature engineering' in machine learning?

options.A: Training a model on new data
options.B: Designing and creating new features from existing data
options.D: Evaluating the performance of the model

questions.question: Which of the following techniques is used to handle imbalanced datasets?

options.A: Principal Component Analysis (PCA)
options.B: SMOTE (Synthetic Minority Over-sampling Technique)

questions.question: Which of the following algorithms is best suited for multi-class classification problems?

options.A: Linear Regression
options.B: Support Vector Machines (SVM)

questions.question: What is the 'kernel trick' used for in the context of Support Vector Machines?

options.A: Increasing the number of support vectors
options.B: Mapping data into a higher-dimensional space

questions.question: What is the primary goal of 'word sense disambiguation' in natural language processing?

options.A: Identifying the most frequent words in a document
options.B: Determining the meaning of a word based on its context
options.C: Parsing a sentence into its grammatical components

questions.question: Which technique is commonly used for feature extraction and dimensionality reduction in image data?

options.A: Principal Component Analysis (PCA)
options.B: Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA)

questions.question: In deep reinforcement learning, what does the term 'exploration' refer to?

options.A: Choosing actions that maximize the immediate reward
options.B: Randomly selecting actions to discover the environment

questions.question: In the context of clustering, what is the 'silhouette score' used for?

options.A: Evaluating the quality of a clustering solution
options.B: Measuring the correlation between features
options.D: Determining the optimal number of clusters

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the Expectation-Maximization (EM) algorithm in Gaussian Mixture Models (GMM)?

options.A: Maximizing the likelihood of the observed data
options.B: Estimating the initial centroids of clusters
options.C: Reducing the number of components in the mixture
options.D: Clustering the data into a hierarchical structure

questions.question: Which technique is commonly used for sequence-to-sequence tasks, such as machine translation?

options.A: Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs)
options.B: Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs)

questions.question: In the context of natural language processing, what is 'coreference resolution' used for?

options.A: Identifying relationships between entities
options.B: Tokenizing text documents

questions.question: What is the primary challenge of 'adversarial machine learning'?

options.A: Training models with limited computational resources
options.B: Protecting machine learning models from adversarial attacks

questions.question: What does the term 'curriculum learning' refer to in machine learning?

options.A: The process of designing a machine learning curriculum
options.B: A learning strategy that gradually increases task difficulty
options.D: A technique for reducing data dimensionality

questions.question: In reinforcement learning, what is the 'temporal credit assignment problem'?

options.A: Assigning credit to actions based on their long-term effects
options.B: Assigning credit to the agent's memory
options.C: Evaluating the convergence of the value function
options.D: Handling the uncertainty in transition probabilities

questions.question: What is the primary objective of 'few-shot learning' in machine learning?

options.A: Training models with limited computational resources
options.B: Achieving high accuracy with a small amount of labeled data

questions.question: In the context of generative adversarial networks (GANs), what is the role of the 'generator' network?

options.A: Generating realistic data samples
options.B: Discriminating between real and fake data

questions.question: Which machine learning technique is commonly used for anomaly detection in time-series data?

options.A: Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs)
options.B: Hidden Markov Models (HMMs)

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of 'transfer entropy' in the analysis of time-series data?

options.A: Measuring the mutual information between time series
options.B: Identifying causal relationships between variables
